content: it, which is line 57 in Example 6-29. Enter dd in the prefix area for this line. Enter another dd on the last line of the file, and then press Enter: g. ====> /PROFILE TCPIP h. ====> up 2 Example 6-29 Example PROFILE TCPIP dd 00058 * ----------------------------------------------------------------- 00059 * Example TCP/IP Server Configuration (PROFILE TCPIP) Modifications 00060 * ----------------------------------------------------------------- 00061 ... 00073 dd 74 * * * End of File * * * i. Filter to show all lines that contain an asterisk (*): ====> all/* j. Suppress any visible lines that are not comment lines by typing an X into the prefix area on those two lines, as shown in Example 6-30. Example 6-30 Suppress lines X 088 :nick.SSL* :type.server :class.ssl ... X 099 :for.SSL* 226 Virtualization Cookbook: Vol 1: IBM z/VM 7.2 k.
